intro: Maytenus undata, commonly known as the creeping mayten, is a shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Phyllanthaceae and is characterized by its dense, sprawling growth habit. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often gland-dotted, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruits are fleshy berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. Maytenus undata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
